name: RunSqlCmdScriptTask
friendlyName: Run SQL Script in SQLCMD mode
description: Run a single SQL Script in SQLCMD mode passing multiple parameters via a SqlCmdVariables array
author: Dr. John Tunnicliffe

inputs.name: Server
inputs.label: Server name or IP address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Server name or IP address.  Include the database instance name and port if necessary (e.g. myserver\myinstance,myport)

inputs.name: Database
inputs.label: The name of the SQL database
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the database against which the script will be run

inputs.name: SqlCmdSciptPath
inputs.label: Path to .sql file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root to the SqlCMD script to run.  Wildcards can be used.  Note that the repo root is held in the variable $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariableType
inputs.label: Provide SQLCMD Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose how you wish to provide SQLCMD Variables to the script.

options.text: Multi-line text input as name/value pairs

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariablesInJson
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables and Values (JSON format)
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of SqlCmd variables and their values in JSON format.

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariablesInText
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables and Values (name/value pair format)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of SqlCmd variables and their values in the format var=varvalue. e.g. 
var1=varvalue1
var2=varvalue2
var3=varvalue3
var4=varvalue4
